moves.2. Nf3 g6 3. d4 d6 4. Nc3 c6: Moving more pawns then recommended, black seemed to be on the defensive, maybe waiting for White's formation plans first and/or making quick quiet moves for better time.
moves.5. Bc4 Bg7 6. O-O b5 7. Bb3 a5 8. a4 b4: Neglecting the superior attack on b4
moves.13... Qc7 14. Bc3 d5 15. exd5 cxd5 16. R: Taking with h2 rather than f2 to avoid opening up the a7-g1 diagonal and safe guarding the king.
moves.22. Qd2: Escaping the future pin that would d4.
moves.22... Bh6: Black makes use of the pin.
moves.24... Ne7 25. Ne5 Nf5 26. Rf3 Qc7 27. g4: Chasing the knight off the b1-h7 diagonal.
moves.33... Ng5 34. Rh1 e5 35. Kf2 Bc4 36. Bxg: Winning the pawn and mate if black recaptures.
moves.36... Rg7 37. Bf5 Rcc7 38. Bd2: Hanging the pawn for the chance to remove blacks defender knight
moves.40... Rgxh7 41. Qg6+ Rhg7 42. Qe8+:
If black moves 42...Qf8 then 43.Rh8  winning the queen by Deflection. Black resigns.
